canonical_explanation.text: A family is a group of people who are related to each other and live together. There are two main types of families: a nuclear family has parents and their children, while a joint family has grandparents, parents, uncles, aunts, and cousins all living together. Every family member has a role — parents earn money and take care of the family, grandparents share wisdom and stories, and children help by keeping their rooms clean and studying well. Families care for each other by sharing, helping when someone is sick, and celebrating festivals together. A family tree is a chart that shows how all members of a family are related to one another.
rules: A nuclear family has parents and their children living together
A joint family has grandparents, parents, uncles, aunts, and cousins living together
Every family member has an important role to play
Families care for each other by sharing, helping, and celebrating together
A family tree is a chart that shows how family members are related

questions.question_text: A family where only parents and their children live together is called a _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A nuclear family is one where only parents and their children live together. It is a small family with fewer members compared to a joint family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A joint family has grandparents, uncles, aunts, and cousins all living together. A neighbourhood or community is not a type of family. The correct answer is nuclear family — where only parents and their children live together.

questions.question_text: In a joint family, who all live together?

options.text: Grandparents, parents, uncles, aunts, and cousins

questions.explanation_correct: In a joint family, grandparents, parents, uncles, aunts, and cousins all live together in the same house. It is a big family with many members.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A joint family is a large family where many relatives live together. It is not just parents and children (that would be a nuclear family), and it is not friends or neighbours. The correct answer is grandparents, parents, uncles, aunts, and cousins.

questions.question_text: Which type of family usually has more members?
questions.explanation_correct: A joint family usually has more members because grandparents, parents, uncles, aunts, and cousins all live together. A nuclear family has only parents and their children, so it is smaller.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A nuclear family has only parents and their children, which means fewer members. A joint family includes grandparents, uncles, aunts, and cousins too, making it larger. So the correct answer is joint family.

questions.question_text: Aarav lives with his mother, father, and younger sister. What type of family does Aarav have?
questions.explanation_correct: Aarav lives with only his parents and his sister. This is a nuclear family because it has just parents and their children living together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aarav's family has only his parents and his sister — no grandparents, uncles, or aunts. This makes it a nuclear family, not a joint family. Neighbourhood family and school family are not types of families.

questions.question_text: Meera lives with her parents, grandparents, uncle, aunt, and two cousins. What type of family does Meera have?
questions.explanation_correct: Meera lives with her parents, grandparents, uncle, aunt, and cousins. Since many relatives live together under one roof, this is a joint family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A nuclear family has only parents and children. Meera's family has grandparents, uncle, aunt, and cousins too. This makes it a joint family — a large family where many relatives live together.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is TRUE about a nuclear family?

options.text: It has grandparents, uncles, and aunts living together
It has only parents and their children
It always has more than ten members
It does not have any children

questions.explanation_correct: A nuclear family has only parents and their children living together. It is a smaller type of family compared to a joint family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A nuclear family does not include grandparents, uncles, or aunts — that would be a joint family. A nuclear family usually has fewer members, not more than ten. The correct answer is that it has only parents and their children.

questions.question_text: Rahul's grandmother, grandfather, parents, uncle, aunt, and three cousins all live in the same house. How many types of generations are living together?
questions.explanation_correct: Three generations are living together: grandparents (first generation), parents and uncle-aunt (second generation), and Rahul and his cousins (third generation). This is a joint family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count the generations carefully. Grandparents are one generation, parents and uncle-aunt are the second generation, and Rahul and his cousins are the third generation. So three generations are living together.

questions.question_text: Who are the parents of your parents called?
questions.explanation_correct: The parents of your parents are called grandparents. Your father's parents are your paternal grandparents, and your mother's parents are your maternal grandparents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Siblings are your brothers and sisters, and cousins are the children of your uncles and aunts. Neighbours are people who live near your house. The parents of your parents are called grandparents.

questions.question_text: What is the main role of parents in a family?

options.text: To earn money and take care of the family
To go on holidays every day

questions.explanation_correct: The main role of parents is to earn money and take care of the family. They provide food, clothes, shelter, and education. They also love and guide their children.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While parents may play games and watch television sometimes, their main role is to earn money, provide food and shelter, and take care of the family. They make sure everyone is safe, healthy, and happy.

questions.question_text: Your brothers and sisters are called your _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Your brothers and sisters are called siblings. They are the children of the same parents as you.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cousins are the children of your uncles and aunts, not your own brothers and sisters. Friends and neighbours are not family terms. Your brothers and sisters are called siblings.

questions.question_text: Grandma tells Riya stories every evening and teaches her to knit. What role is grandma playing in the family?

options.text: She is not doing anything useful
She is guiding and sharing her knowledge
She is a neighbour helping out

questions.explanation_correct: Grandma is guiding and sharing her knowledge with Riya. Grandparents play an important role by sharing stories, wisdom, and skills with younger family members.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Grandparents play a very important role in the family. By telling stories and teaching skills like knitting, grandma is sharing her knowledge and keeping family traditions alive. This is valuable, not a waste of time.

questions.question_text: Ankit helps his mother set the table for dinner and his sister waters the plants. What does this show?

options.text: Children should not help at home
Only adults should do household work
Children can help with small tasks at home

questions.explanation_correct: This shows that children can help with small tasks at home. Setting the table and watering plants are simple jobs that children can do to help their family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Children are important members of the family too. They can help with small tasks like setting the table, watering plants, keeping their room clean, and putting toys away. This teaches them responsibility and helps the family.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a role that children can play in a family?

options.text: Helping in the kitchen with small tasks

questions.explanation_correct: Driving a car is NOT something children can do. Children are too young to drive. But they can keep their room clean, help in the kitchen with small tasks, and study well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping the room clean, helping in the kitchen, and studying are all things children can and should do. But driving a car is something only adults with a driving licence can do. Children must never try to drive.

questions.question_text: Your mother's brother is your _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Your mother's brother is your maternal uncle, often called 'mama' in Hindi. 'Maternal' means from your mother's side of the family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Your father is your mother's husband, not her brother. Your grandfather is your parent's father. A cousin is your uncle or aunt's child. Your mother's brother is your maternal uncle (mama).

questions.question_text: How do family members show that they care for each other?

options.text: By sharing, helping, and loving each other
By never talking to each other

questions.explanation_correct: Family members show they care by sharing things, helping each other when needed, and loving one another. They celebrate festivals together and take care of each other when someone is sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fighting, ignoring, or not talking are not ways of showing care. Family members show care by sharing, helping when someone is sick, celebrating together, and always being kind and loving to each other.

questions.question_text: When your grandmother is not feeling well, what should you do?

options.text: Take care of her and ask if she needs anything

questions.explanation_correct: When grandmother is not well, you should take care of her and ask if she needs anything. You can bring her water, sit with her, or call an elder for help. This is how families care for each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When a family member is sick, we should not ignore them or make noise. We should take care of them by sitting with them, bringing water or food, and asking if they need help. Caring for each other is what families do.

questions.question_text: During Diwali, Priya's whole family cleans the house together, makes sweets, and decorates with diyas. What does this show about her family?

options.text: They celebrate and work together as a family

questions.explanation_correct: This shows that Priya's family celebrates and works together. When family members clean, cook, and decorate together, it makes the festival more joyful and strengthens their bond.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Priya's whole family is involved — cleaning, making sweets, and decorating. This shows they celebrate together as a family. Working and celebrating together is an important way families show love and care for each other.

questions.question_text: Rohan's little brother fell down and started crying. What should Rohan do?

options.text: Help his brother get up and comfort him

questions.explanation_correct: Rohan should help his little brother get up and comfort him. As an elder sibling, he should care for his younger brother. He can also call an adult if his brother is hurt.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Laughing at someone or walking away when they are hurt is not kind. Rohan should help his brother get up, comfort him, and check if he is hurt. If the injury looks serious, he should call a parent or elder right away.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a way of caring for your family?

options.text: Sharing your things and helping when someone is sick

questions.explanation_correct: Sharing your things and helping when someone is sick are ways of caring for your family. Caring means thinking about others and doing things to make them happy and comfortable.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not helping, watching TV alone, and wasting food are not caring behaviours. Sharing your things, helping when someone is sick, and spending time together are real ways to show that you care about your family.

questions.question_text: Why is it important for family members to spend time together?

options.text: It is not important at all
It helps them understand and love each other more
Only so they can watch TV together

questions.explanation_correct: Spending time together helps family members understand each other better and strengthens their love and bond. They can talk, share stories, play, eat, and celebrate together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Spending time together is very important for a family. It is not just about watching TV or only during exams. When family members spend time together, they talk, share, laugh, and grow closer to each other.

questions.question_text: What is a family tree?

options.text: A tree planted by the family in the garden
A chart that shows how family members are related
A list of fruits in the house
A tree that grows inside the house

questions.explanation_correct: A family tree is a chart or diagram that shows how family members are related to each other. It shows parents, grandparents, children, and other relatives in a tree-like shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A family tree is not an actual tree! It is a chart or diagram drawn on paper that shows the names and relationships of family members. Grandparents are usually at the top, then parents, and then children at the bottom.

questions.question_text: In a family tree, who is usually shown at the top?
questions.explanation_correct: In a family tree, grandparents are usually shown at the top because they are the eldest members. Below them come parents, and then children at the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A family tree starts with the eldest members at the top. Grandparents are the eldest, so they go on top. Parents come next, and children are at the bottom. Pets and friends are not part of a family tree.

questions.question_text: In Sana's family tree, her father's parents are shown above her father. What are they called?
questions.explanation_correct: Sana's father's parents are her paternal grandparents. 'Paternal' means from the father's side. Her mother's parents would be her maternal grandparents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Maternal grandparents are from the mother's side. Siblings are brothers and sisters, and cousins are children of uncles and aunts. Sana's father's parents are her paternal grandparents — 'paternal' means from the father's side.

questions.question_text: Arjun is making a family tree. His grandfather and grandmother are at the top. Below them are his father and his father's sister. Who is his father's sister to Arjun?
questions.explanation_correct: Arjun's father's sister is his aunt, called 'bua' in Hindi. She is his paternal aunt because she is from his father's side of the family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Arjun's mother is his father's wife, not his father's sister. A cousin is the child of an uncle or aunt. A grandmother is a parent's mother. Arjun's father's sister is his aunt, known as 'bua' in Hindi.

questions.question_text: Kavya's family has 4 members: her mother, father, and her brother. Neha's family has 10 members including grandparents, parents, uncle, aunt, and cousins. Which statement is correct?

options.text: Kavya has a joint family and Neha has a nuclear family
Kavya has a nuclear family and Neha has a joint family

questions.explanation_correct: Kavya has a nuclear family because only her parents and brother live together (4 members). Neha has a joint family because grandparents, uncle, aunt, and cousins also live together (10 members).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A nuclear family has only parents and children. A joint family has grandparents, uncles, aunts, and cousins too. Kavya's 4-member family with just parents and brother is nuclear. Neha's 10-member family with grandparents, uncle, aunt, and cousins is joint.

questions.question_text: Your father's brother is your _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Your father's brother is your paternal uncle, called 'chacha' (if younger than father) or 'tauji' (if older than father) in Hindi. Paternal means from the father's side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Maternal uncle is your mother's brother. Grandfather is your parent's father. Cousin is your uncle's or aunt's child. Your father's brother is your paternal uncle — chacha or tauji in Hindi.

questions.question_text: What can children do to show they care about their family?

options.text: Leave their toys and books scattered everywhere
Help with small household chores and study well
Shout and argue all the time

questions.explanation_correct: Children can show they care by helping with small household chores like keeping their room clean, watering plants, and studying well. These small acts make parents happy and help the family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaving things scattered, shouting, and not listening are not caring behaviours. Children show care by helping at home, studying well, being polite, and spending time with family members.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the role of grandparents in a family?

options.text: They have no role to play
They guide the family and share stories and wisdom
They go to school every day

questions.explanation_correct: Grandparents guide the family and share stories and wisdom from their experience. They also help take care of grandchildren and keep family traditions alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Grandparents play a very important role. They share their life experiences, tell stories, teach values, and help take care of grandchildren. They are the elders of the family and their guidance is very valuable.

questions.question_text: Which statement is TRUE?

options.text: A nuclear family is always better than a joint family
A joint family is always better than a nuclear family
Both types of families have their own advantages
Only joint families are real families

questions.explanation_correct: Both nuclear and joint families have their own advantages. In a nuclear family, there is more privacy. In a joint family, there is more support and company. Neither is better than the other — both are real, loving families.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No type of family is better than another. Nuclear families are smaller and may have more privacy. Joint families are larger with more people to share and help. Both are equally good and loving. The correct answer is that both have their own advantages.

questions.question_text: In a family tree, Reema's mother's mother is shown. What relation is she to Reema?
questions.explanation_correct: Reema's mother's mother is her maternal grandmother, called 'nani' in Hindi. Maternal means from the mother's side of the family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Paternal grandmother is the father's mother (dadi). An aunt is the sister of a parent. A sister is a sibling. Reema's mother's mother is her maternal grandmother — called 'nani' in Hindi.

questions.question_text: It is Eid, and Zara's family is preparing biryani together. Her brother is setting the table and Zara is helping her mother. This shows that _____.

options.text: Everyone in the family can help and celebrate together
Children should not help at home

questions.explanation_correct: This shows that everyone in the family can help and celebrate together. When all family members — parents and children — work together, festivals become more joyful and special.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cooking and helping are not the job of only one person. When the whole family works together during a festival, it brings happiness and togetherness. Both boys and girls, parents and children can all help.

questions.question_text: Aditya's father works in an office and his mother is a doctor. Who takes care of Aditya when both parents are at work?

options.text: Grandparents or other family elders may take care
Aditya stays alone at the office

questions.explanation_correct: When both parents work, grandparents or other family elders often take care of children. In some families, a trusted caretaker may also help. This is one of the advantages of having a supportive family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Children cannot be left alone or drive themselves. When both parents work, grandparents, elder family members, or trusted caretakers help take care of children. This is an important part of family support.

questions.question_text: A nuclear family has only parents and their children living together.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A nuclear family is made up of only parents and their children. It is a smaller type of family compared to a joint family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A nuclear family does have only parents and their children living together. It does not include grandparents, uncles, aunts, or cousins. So this statement is true.

questions.question_text: A joint family has fewer members than a nuclear family.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A joint family usually has MORE members than a nuclear family because grandparents, uncles, aunts, and cousins all live together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A joint family includes grandparents, parents, uncles, aunts, and cousins, so it has more members than a nuclear family (which has only parents and children). This statement is false.

questions.question_text: Family members should help and care for each other.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Family members should always help and care for each other. Sharing, helping when someone is sick, and spending time together makes a family strong and happy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Family members should definitely help and care for each other. A happy family is one where everyone shares, helps, and loves one another. This statement is true.

questions.question_text: A family tree is a real tree that grows in the garden.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A family tree is not a real tree. It is a chart or diagram drawn on paper that shows how family members are related to each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A family tree is not an actual tree. It is a diagram or chart that shows the names of family members and how they are connected. It looks like a tree shape, which is why it is called a family tree.

questions.question_text: Your mother's parents are called your paternal grandparents.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Your mother's parents are called your MATERNAL grandparents (nana and nani). Paternal grandparents (dada and dadi) are your father's parents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Paternal means from the father's side. Your mother's parents are your MATERNAL grandparents (nana and nani in Hindi). Your father's parents are your paternal grandparents (dada and dadi). This statement is false.

questions.question_text: Celebrating festivals together helps families grow closer.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. When families celebrate festivals together — cooking, decorating, and praying — they spend quality time and their bond becomes stronger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Celebrating festivals together is a wonderful way for families to bond. When family members cook, decorate, and enjoy together, they create happy memories and grow closer. This statement is true.

questions.question_text: A family where grandparents, parents, uncles, aunts, and cousins all live together is called a _____ family.
questions.explanation_correct: A joint family is one where grandparents, parents, uncles, aunts, and cousins all live together under one roof. It is a large family with many members.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When many relatives like grandparents, uncles, aunts, and cousins live together, it is called a joint family. The missing word is 'joint'. A nuclear family has only parents and children.

questions.question_text: Your brothers and sisters are called your _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Your brothers and sisters are called siblings. They are children of the same parents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is siblings. Brothers and sisters who have the same parents are called siblings. Cousins are the children of your uncles and aunts, which is different.

questions.question_text: A chart that shows how family members are related is called a family _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A chart that shows how family members are related is called a family tree. It is drawn like a tree, with the eldest members at the top and younger ones at the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is tree. A family tree is a chart or diagram showing how all members of a family are related. It gets its name from its tree-like shape.

questions.question_text: Your father's mother is your _____ grandmother.
questions.explanation_correct: Your father's mother is your paternal grandmother, called 'dadi' in Hindi. Paternal means from the father's side of the family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is paternal. Paternal means from your father's side. Your father's mother is your paternal grandmother (dadi), and your mother's mother is your maternal grandmother (nani).

questions.question_text: Families grow closer by sharing, helping, and _____ festivals together.
questions.explanation_correct: Families grow closer by sharing, helping, and celebrating festivals together. Festivals like Diwali, Eid, and Christmas bring families together for fun and joy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is celebrating. When families celebrate festivals together, they cook, decorate, exchange gifts, and create happy memories. This strengthens the family bond.

questions.question_text: The children of your uncle or aunt are your _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The children of your uncle or aunt are your cousins. Cousins are relatives of the same generation as you, but from your uncle's or aunt's family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Siblings are your own brothers and sisters. Grandparents are your parents' parents. Neighbours are people who live near you. The children of your uncle or aunt are called cousins.

questions.question_text: Which of these activities helps strengthen family bonds?

options.text: Everyone eating alone in their rooms
Eating dinner together and talking about the day

questions.explanation_correct: Eating dinner together and talking about the day helps strengthen family bonds. When family members sit together, eat, and share their experiences, they feel connected and loved.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating alone, ignoring each other, and never going out together weakens family bonds. Eating together, talking, sharing stories, and spending time together makes a family stronger and happier.

questions.question_text: In a family tree, Vivek's mother's sister's children are Vivek's _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Vivek's mother's sister is his aunt (mausi). The children of his mausi are his cousins. Cousins are children of your parents' siblings.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Siblings are your own brothers and sisters. Grandparents are much older relatives. Uncle and aunt are from the parents' generation. Vivek's mother's sister's children are his cousins.

questions.question_text: Deepa used to live in a nuclear family. Now her grandparents have moved in with them. What type of family does Deepa have now?
questions.explanation_correct: Now that grandparents have moved in with Deepa's parents and children, it has become a joint family. A joint family has members from more than two generations living together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A nuclear family has only parents and children. When grandparents also come to live with them, it becomes a joint family because now three generations are living together under one roof.

questions.question_text: In a family, only parents have roles and responsibilities. Children do not have any role.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Everyone in a family has a role, including children. Children can help by keeping their room clean, studying well, respecting elders, and helping with small chores.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Children also have important roles in a family. They should keep their rooms clean, study well, help with small household tasks, and respect their elders. Every family member, big or small, has a role to play.

questions.question_text: Isha's grandmother taught her how to make mango pickle. What value does this show?

options.text: Family traditions and knowledge are passed from elders to children

questions.explanation_correct: This shows that family traditions and knowledge are passed from elders to children. Grandparents share recipes, stories, skills, and traditions that keep the family culture alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Grandparents are wonderful teachers. They pass on family traditions, recipes, and valuable life lessons to younger generations. Learning to make mango pickle from grandma keeps the family tradition alive.

questions.question_text: Your mother's mother is called your _____ grandmother or nani.
questions.explanation_correct: Your mother's mother is called your maternal grandmother, known as 'nani' in Hindi. Maternal means from the mother's side of the family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is maternal. Maternal means from your mother's side. Your mother's mother is your maternal grandmother (nani), and your father's mother is your paternal grandmother (dadi).
